ratings.comment: Dr. Ofori was an excellent professor.  He presented detailed material and we were not just lectured to but asked to participate and explain the linguistic structures we were studying.  He was helpful in answering all of our questions if we needed added clarification.  His homework and  linguistic explanations were  specific  to our African languages.
Seth is a wonderful professor with an unparalleled amount of passion for sociolinguistics. He is laugh is absolutely contagious!!

Professor Ofori is the best. His knowledge of language and linguistics issues is unparalleled. His introduction to this class is superb, and I have learned so much having to write about and discuss language situations in several African countries. He is also a very generous and respectful human being.
One of the best classes I have taken on this UW-Campus. Good notes, interesting class discussions; and the instructor is very knowledgeable on the subject and cares very much about students success

Very knowledgeable Professor. He cares very much about his students success. We are having lot of in class discussion. He teaches to my understanding and gives good notes. All his notes are at Learn at UW. You will learn a lot taking this class as his expectations are very clear.

Seth is an enthusiastic teacher and very knowledgable on the subject, but he is extremely confusing.  He stands in front of the class and just talks for the full time.... he also writes complete gibberish on the board.  If you are someone who needs clean notes and clear direction, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
highly intelligent, a philosopher, a theorist, an inspirer; you meet him and will not be the same
A very helpful and brilliant Professor
Great Professor, very knowledgeable and highly prepared for his classes. He is an asset on African Linguistics!
Students at the university are not only taking you course. Try to teach like an American Professor not an African Professor!

I was shocked at how ambiguous he is. We had to write a paper about Arabic Phonogy and he didn't give us any data! He told me to go to a TA in Arabic to get some words to anylize. Why would I go to a TA for a class that I'm not in to get help? Also, for half of his assignments we had to look up the definitions of words and type them up. Useless.
Students aren't taking your course only at the university. reduce the work load

Seth is extremely helpful. He cares very much about the success of his students and is very generous with his time. I felt very comfortable to ask questions in his class and we will give him drafts of our projects to proofread. The assignments were a lot though but I guess were necessary.
He is simply the best I have ever had on this campus. I have learnt a lot taking his classes. He is a lifelong teacher.
Seth is very intellingent and helpful. His courses are well-organized. I totally disagree with the rest. If you have registrated a class with him please go ahead and take it and you will enjoy it

If you are signed up for any of his classes, DROP THEM! I was excited about the class but he killed my interest because of his stubbornness and unclear expectations of students. But what can I say, I'm biased- he kicked me out of his office when I didn't understand my final exam grade.

He is the most incomprehensible professor I have ever had.  He does not understand how to teach.  The goal of the class was not clearly stated, and he seems more obsessed with having people present than the quality of work.  I highly recommend to not take any of his classes.

He is knowledgeable about linguistics- but it's not enough. He wasn't organized or clear about what exactly students had to do. Someone asked about what day a paper was due, he said "look at the syllabus" which said things like "Paper due the following week's Thursday after the exam week." Not for the OCD student.
